Interface Board

All Known Implementing Classes:
SimpleBoard
public interface Board
Interface representing the game board for a Tetris game.

This interface defines the core operations for managing the game board, including piece movement, rotation, locking, and row clearing. It provides methods to interact with the game state and retrieve information about the current board and pieces.

Implementations of this interface should manage:

  • The game board matrix (2D array representing occupied cells)
  • The current falling piece and its position
  • Piece generation and rotation
  • Collision detection
  • Row clearing and scoring
Version:
1.0
Author:
Rajul Kabir
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • moveBrickDown

      boolean moveBrickDown()
      Attempts to move the current piece down by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if the piece cannot move down (collision)

    • moveBrickLeft

      boolean moveBrickLeft()
      Attempts to move the current piece left by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if the piece cannot move left (collision or boundary)

    • moveBrickRight

      boolean moveBrickRight()
      Attempts to move the current piece right by one cell.
      Returns:
      true if the move was successful, false if the piece cannot move right (collision or boundary)

    • rotateLeftBrick

      boolean rotateLeftBrick()
      Attempts to rotate the current piece counter-clockwise.
      Returns:
      true if the rotation was successful, false if the piece cannot rotate (collision)

    • createNewBrick

      boolean createNewBrick()
      Creates a new piece at the top of the board.

      This method generates a new piece from the brick generator and places it at the default starting position. If the piece immediately collides with existing blocks, the game is over.

      Returns:
      true if the new piece collides immediately (game over), false otherwise

    • getBoardMatrix

      int[][] getBoardMatrix()
      Gets the current game board matrix.

      The matrix represents the state of all locked blocks on the board. Each cell contains either 0 (empty) or a color code (1-7) representing a locked block.

      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the game board state

    • getViewData

      ViewData getViewData()
      Gets the view data for the current falling piece.

      This includes the piece's shape, position, and the next piece preview.

      Returns:
      ViewData containing the current piece information

    • mergeBrickToBackground

      void mergeBrickToBackground()
      Merges the current falling piece into the board background.

      This method is called when a piece can no longer move down. The piece becomes part of the locked board state.

    • clearRows

      ClearRow clearRows()
      Clears any completed rows and returns information about the clear operation.

      This method checks for fully filled rows, removes them, shifts remaining blocks down, and calculates the score bonus.

      Returns:
      ClearRow object containing information about cleared rows and score bonus

    • getScore

      Score getScore()
      Gets the score object for this game.
      Returns:
      The Score object managing the game's score

    • newGame

      void newGame()
      Resets the board to start a new game.

      This clears the board matrix, resets the score, and creates a new starting piece.

    • getSecondNextBrickData

      int[][] getSecondNextBrickData()
      Gets the shape data for the second next piece in the queue.

      This is used for displaying the next piece preview queue.

      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the second next piece's shape

    • getThirdNextBrickData

      int[][] getThirdNextBrickData()
      Gets the shape data for the third next piece in the queue.

      This is used for displaying the next piece preview queue.

      Returns:
      A 2D array representing the third next piece's shape

    • setBrick

      boolean setBrick(Brick brick, int rotation)
      Sets a specific brick as the current piece with a given rotation.

      This method is primarily used for the hold/swap functionality, allowing a previously held piece to be placed on the board.

      Parameters:
      brick - The brick to set as the current piece
      rotation - The rotation state (0-3) for the brick
      Returns:
      true if the brick collides immediately at the starting position, false otherwise
